comment:
* Provides information about the environment for a particular APEX.
 *
 * @hide

methods.name: public static ApexEnvironment getApexEnvironment(@NonNull String apexModuleName)
methods.comment:
* Returns an ApexEnvironment instance for the APEX with the provided {@code apexModuleName}. * *

To preserve the safety and integrity of APEX modules, you must only obtain the * ApexEnvironment for your specific APEX, and you must never attempt to obtain an * ApexEnvironment for another APEX. Any coordination between APEXs must be performed through * well-defined interfaces; attempting to directly read or write raw files belonging to another * APEX will violate the hermetic storage requirements placed upon each module.

methods.name: public File getDeviceProtectedDataDir()
methods.comment:
* Returns the data directory for the APEX in device-encrypted, non-user-specific storage. * *

This directory is automatically created by the system for installed APEXes, and its * contents will be rolled back if the APEX is rolled back.

methods.name: public File getDeviceProtectedDataDirForUser(@NonNull UserHandle user)
methods.comment:
* Returns the data directory for the APEX in device-encrypted, user-specific storage for the * specified {@code user}. * *

This directory is automatically created by the system for each user and for each installed * APEX, and its contents will be rolled back if the APEX is rolled back.

methods.name: public File getCredentialProtectedDataDirForUser(@NonNull UserHandle user)
methods.comment:
* Returns the data directory for the APEX in credential-encrypted, user-specific storage for * the specified {@code user}. * *

This directory is automatically created by the system for each user and for each installed * APEX, and its contents will be rolled back if the APEX is rolled back.

methodNames: public static ApexEnvironment getApexEnvironment(@NonNull String apexModuleName)
